title: 76ers draft Broome, Suns land Fleming in Round 2
content: Johni Broome went to the 76ers with the No. 35 pick while Rasheer Fleming ended up with the Suns via trade as the NBA draft wrapped up Thursday night.

title: Rays' Franco found guilty in sexual abuse case
content: Rays shortstop Wander Franco was found guilty of sexual abuse of a minor in the Dominican Republic and received a suspended two-year prison sentence Thursday.

title: Ex-Ravens PK Tucker gets 10-week suspension
content: Former Ravens kicker Justin Tucker has been suspended for the first 10 weeks of the 2025 regular season after the NFL found that he violated its personal conduct policy.

title: Sources: Team in top five told not to pick Bailey
content: Ace Bailey's representatives informed a team drafting inside the top five that they didn't want that team to select the Rutgers wing and that he wouldn't report if it did, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets fear Canning has Achilles injury, await MRI
content: The Mets' Griffin Canning is set to undergo imaging after leaving Thursday's start because of a noncontact injury, and the team fears it's his Achilles.

title: Alabama gets commitment from No. 3 RB Crowell
content: Alabama secured its highest-ranked commitment in the 2026 class Thursday when four-star rusher Ezavier Crowell, ESPN's No. 3 running back prospect and No. 2 recruit from the state of Alabama, committed to the Crimson Tide.

title: Hayes on Lavelle's stellar return: 'Only one Rose'
content: Rose Lavelle scored a goal and added an assist in her first international minutes in nearly seven months on Thursday as the United States beat Ireland 4-0 at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado.

title: SB LIX performer arrested for halftime protest
content: A performer at Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl halftime show in February has been arrested after holding up a Sudanese flag there with the message "Sudan and Free Gaza."

title: üèà One last offseason move for every NFL team
content: Which signings, trades and extensions should still happen this offseason? We suggested one final move for every NFL team as we near training camp.

content: The A's star is a former first-round pick and the son of a major leaguer, but the secret to his success starts with a video game controller.

title: MLB Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

content: While the top two picks appear to be locked in, what happens after that? Here's the final projection before Friday's first round.

title: NHL draft buzz: Sharks not set at No. 2?
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: 5 questions the USMNT must answer in Gold Cup knockouts (and before 2026 World Cup)
content: The USMNT finished the Gold Cup group stage without a loss, and yet no one seems particularly comforted by that. These five questions need answers ASAP.

title: 'The search for a QB1 in Cleveland continues': Blue Jays troll Browns, Guardians after error
content: Toronto trolled two Cleveland teams with a jab at the Browns' quarterback situation after a Guardians error.

content: History would indicate the Eagles won't repeat, so who else in the NFC East stands a chance to win the division?

content: Four of the Florida high school's Class of 2024 starting five were selected as first-rounders in this year's draft.

title: Club World Cup Daily: Madrid win group, Man City get dominant win over Juventus
content: Real Madrid's 3-0 win over RB Salzburg sees them win Group H on the final day of group stage action. Here's what you need to know from Wednesday's Club World Cup action.

title: Wrexham to open Ch'ship season at Southampton
content: Wrexham will begin their first Championship campaign in over 40 years away at former Premier League side Southampton, before a tough run in their first five.

title: Liverpool sign Kerkez, spending nears $197M
content: Liverpool have completed the signing of Bournemouth left-back Milos Kerkez, the Premier League champions have announced.

title: Arsenal starlet Lewis-Skelly signs long-term deal
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly has signed a new long-term contract at Arsenal, the Premier League club confirmed on Thursday.

title: Bar√ßa chief Laporta: Madrid have model of 'power'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta has said Cl√°sico rivals Real Madrid have a model of "power" and "signing players" that contrasts with how the Catalan club is run.

title: √âderson shuts down exit talk; to remain at Man City
content: √âderson has committed his future to Manchester City and insists he intends to stay at the Etihad Stadium next season.

title: Otamendi: 'I don't see Messi missing World Cup'
content: Benfica defender Nicol√°s Otamendi has said he doesn't expect Argentina teammate Lionel Messi to miss the 2026 World Cup.

title: Xabi calls on Vini, Mbapp√© to 'improve' off the ball
content: Xabi Alonso called on Real Madrid stars like Vin√≠cius J√∫nior and Kylian Mbapp√© to "improve" their off-the-ball work-rate ahead of the team's final Club World Cup group game with Salzburg.

title: Argentina 2nd tier player, 18, dies during surgery
content: Camilo Nuin, an 18-year-old player for Argentina second division team San Telmo, died on Wednesday during knee surgery.

title: 'Everything's on the table' for Connor McDavid's NHL future
content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

title: Taylor Swift joins Kane Brown in surprise performance
content: Taylor Swift performs 'Shake It Off' and walks the red carpet with Travis Kelce at Tight End University.

title: How Elite 11 changed the ESPN 300 QB rankings
content: Following the summer camp circuit, the newest rankings have some big changes for the class's signal-callers.

title: Meet the favorites, sleepers and spoilers of NASCAR's first in-season tournament
content: Whether you're a weekly watcher or a casual Cup fan, this guide will get you up to speed on the drivers in the bracket.

title: Which rookies should you roster in 2025-26?
content: Andre Snellings looks at what fantasy managers can expect from Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper, Ace Bailey and other touted rookies in fantasy basketball next season.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 5: Cannons the new No. 1
content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

title: How Shubhanshu Shukla Is Spending His 1st Day At International Space Station
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, also called 'Shux', landed at the ISS at 4:01 pm (IST). The ISS usually follows Greenwich/London time.

title: A United Thackeray March Against "Hindi Imposition" In Maharashtra Schools
content: In a rare convergence, estranged cousins Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray have agreed to join forces against what they describe as the "imposition" of Hindi in Maharashtra's school curriculum.

title: "Where Did He Come From?": Rapper 50 Cent On Zohran Mamdani's Tax Plans
content: Rapper 50 Cent has taken aim at Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for New York mayor polls, over his proposed tax policies, offering the candidate a "first class one-way ticket" out of the city.

title: 22 Years Later, Man Who Killed His 3rd Wife, Stuffed Her In Bag, Arrested
content: A 75-year-old man, on the run for over two decades, has been arrested in Karnataka's Koppal district for murdering his third wife in 2002.

title: Bangkok-Bound Air India Flight Delayed For 5 Hours After Hay Found In Wing
content: A Bangkok-bound Air India flight from the city was held back for over five hours on June 25, after some hay was found stuck in one of the aircraft's wings, the airline has said.

title: 2 Men Seen Near Zeeshan Siddique's Office Detained, Released Later
content: Two men were detained on Thursday night for loitering near the Bandra office of former MLA Zeeshan Siddique, whose father and former minister Baba Siddiquewas gunned down close by on October 12 last year.

title: "Dismayed Such Incidents Continue To Recur": India On Damage To Dhaka Temple
content: India on Thursday denounced the reported destruction of a Durga temple in Dhaka and said it is the responsibility of Bangladesh's interim government to protect Hindus as well as religious institutions.

title: Hyderabad Couple Records Their Sexual Acts, Sells Clips For Rs 2,000, Arrested
content: A 41-year-old man and his 37-year-old wife were arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly live streaming their sexual acts on a mobile app in exchange for money, police said.

title: Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez To Say 'I Do' At Lavish Wedding In Venice Today
content: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez kicked off a three-day wedding celebration Thursday with guests including Kim and Khloe Kardashian, Oprah Winfrey and Orlando Bloom.

title: On Camera, Gangster's Mother Shot Dead In Punjab
content: The mother of jailed gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria and another person accompanying her died after being shot at by unidentified bike-borne people in Punjab's Batala, police said on Friday.

title: Devotees Gather For Grand Rath Yatra Of Lord Jagannath In Puri
content: A large crowd of devotees has gathered at Puri's Jagannath Temple for Lord Jagannath's Rath Yatra that will commence on Friday.

title: "Searched A Lot": Israel Admits Plot To Kill Iran's Ayatollah Khamenei
content: Israel's Defence Minister Israel Katz has claimed that his country's military actively sought to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, during the recent Israel-Iran tensions, but failed to identify a viable opportunity.

title: Japan Hangs 'Twitter Killer' In 1st Execution Since 2022
content: Takahiro Shiraishi had been sentenced to death for his 2017 strangling and dismembering of eight women and one man in his apartment near Tokyo.

title: Updates: Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez To Marry In Venice Today
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez have arrived in Venice ahead of their wedding.

title: 2 Men Who Killed Raja Retract 'Confessions', Silent Before Magistrate: Cops
content: Two of the three men who helped Sonam Raghuvanshi murder her husband Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya last month have retracted their earlier "confessions" and refused to testify against themselves before the magistrate, police said.

title: Trump's Daughter, Bill Gates: Celebrities Arrive In Venice For Jeff Bezos Wedding
content: Some 200-250 A-listers from show business, politics and finance are expected to take part in Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's event, dubbed "the wedding of the century".

title: Rajnath Singh Holds "Constructive" Bilateral Talks With Chinese Counterpart
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh held a meeting with his Chinese counterpart Admiral Don Jun on the sidelines of SCO Defence Ministers Meeting in Qingdao in China.

title: Delhi Minister Inspects Night Shelters, Flags Corruption, Warns of CBI Probe
content: Delhi's Urban Development Minister Ashish Sood conducted a surprise inspection of five night shelters at Sarai Kale Khan parking site on Thursday and flagged serious irregularities.

title: Chinese Defence Minister Meets Rajnath Singh At SCO Summit
content: China's Defence Minister Dong Jun Thursday held separate bilateral meetings with his counterparts from member nations of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO), including India, Chinese media reported.

title: "Very Big One": Donald Trump Hints At "Great" Trade Deal With India
content: Addressing the 'Big Beautiful Event' at the White House, Donald Trump said he has a "great deal" with India.

title: Five underappreciated starting pitchers you need to grab now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

title: 10 undervalued pass-catchers with intriguing upside or safer floors
content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Woltemade nearing move to Bayern
content: Bayern Munich are set to get their new striker in Stuttgart's Nick Woltemade. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Avoid new complexities': Rajnath's message to China after firm stance on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Chinese counterpart, Dong Jun, in Qingdao during the SCO Defence Ministers' Meeting, where they discussed the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Suspended initially due to Covid-19 in 2020 and later due to the Galwan Valley clash, the pilgrimage is now set to resume. Singh also gifted Dong Jun a Madhubani painting from Bihar as a gesture of goodwill.

title: 'Brightest blast I've ever seen': Fighter pilot recalls Iran strike by B-2 bombers
content: In June 2025, the US military executed 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' a strike on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, culminating years of meticulous planning and weapon development. The mission, authorized by President Trump, involved B-2 crews deploying GBU-57 bunker-busters to target the facility's vent shafts. While the US asserts 'total obliteration,' Iran disputes the impact, though the IAEA confirmed extensive damage.

title: 'Your clothes, slippers came from us': BJP MLA‚Äôs comment sparks row;
content: Former Maharashtra minister Babanrao Lonikar ignited controversy by criticizing youths for social media criticism despite benefiting from government schemes. His remarks drew swift condemnation from opposition leaders, who deemed them arrogant and insulting. Chief Minister Fadnavis also reprimanded Lonikar, emphasizing the inappropriateness of such statements, especially given the government's service-oriented approach.

title: 'Very big one': Trump hints India, US on cusp of 'great' trade deal; 10 things to know
content: US President Donald Trump hinted at a significant trade deal with India, following a recent agreement with China. Negotiations are underway in Washington, led by Chief Negotiator Rajesh Agarwal, aiming to bridge gaps in the proposed bilateral agreement.

title: 'Will you let me sleep?': Shikhar reveals smuggling girlfriend into room shared with Rohit Sharma; Hitman said ...
content: Shikhar Dhawan, in his autobiography, revealed a past relationship during the 2006 India A tour to Australia. He secretly brought his girlfriend into his hotel room, shared with Rohit Sharma, leading to distractions and impacting his performance. A senior selector spotted them, and despite the romantic interlude, Dhawan later had a successful international career.

title: America‚Äôs China threat: Huawei‚Äôs new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: 'Iran can never get nukes': US secretary of state Rubio talks tough with Pak PM
content: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned Pakistan about Iran's nuclear ambitions during a call with Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif. This followed US military strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, sparking controversy in Islamabad.

title: Trump accuses Democrats of leaking intel on Iran strike; calls for prosecution
content: President Trump accuses Democrats of leaking intelligence regarding a U.S. strike on Iranian nuclear sites, calling for prosecution. The FBI is investigating the leak of a DIA report suggesting the strikes were ineffective, with the administration suspecting a personal grievance against Trump motivated the leaker.

title: 'Will attack more US bases if ...': Iran's Ayatollah Khamenei issues threat
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in a televised address, warned of targeting US military bases in the Middle East if attacked, claiming victory after striking a US base in Qatar. He dismissed Trump's demands and asserted Iran's capability to strike American facilities. Netanyahu proclaimed a historic victory for Israel, vowing continued collaboration with Trump against common enemies.

title: US Embassy warns: Missing info on visa form can get you rejected; Applicants must list all‚Ä¶
content: The US Embassy in India has cautioned visa seekers to accurately disclose their social media presence. Failing to list all usernames and handles used across various platforms in the last five years on the DS-160 form could result in visa denial and future ineligibility.

title: ‚ÄòHibanama‚Äô: MP‚Äôs driver gets Rs 150cr ‚Äògift‚Äô; Hyd's Salar Jung heirs involved; EOW flags deal
content: The driver of Shiv Sena MP Sandipan Bhumre and his MLA son, Vilas, is under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) regarding a gift deed ('Hibanama') for a prime three-acre land worth ‚Çπ150 crore. The land, located in Dawoodpura, was purportedly gifted by descendants of the Salar Jung family of Hyderabad.

title: IND vs ENG - 'How many dams will Bumrah be able to construct?': Ashwin tears into Siraj
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has voiced concerns over Mohammed Siraj's performance in the recent Test match against England, urging him to prioritize controlling the run flow over solely focusing on taking wickets. Jasprit Bumrah stood out as India's best bowler in England‚Äôs first innings, claiming a five-wicket haul. Prasidh Krishna also picked up three wickets but was expensive, conceding runs at an economy of 6.40.

title: 'Wanted to kill Khamenei but ...': Israel reveals how Ayatollah evaded assassination
content: During the recent conflict, Israeli defence minister Israel Katz revealed that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was a target for assassination but evaded capture by going into hiding. Despite this, Israel launched airstrikes, killing Iranian commanders and nuclear scientists, aiming to destabilize Iran's leadership.

title: Population warning again: Elon Musk to parents; you must have more kids if‚Ä¶
content: Elon Musk is again raising alarms about plummeting global fertility rates, asserting that a 2.7 children per woman average is needed for population stability, higher than previously thought. He highlights declining birth rates in the US, Italy, and Japan, warning of potential labor shortages and economic stagnation. Musk draws parallels to historical civilizational collapses, attributing them to demographic decline.

title: Punjab gang war: Gangster's mother shot dead in Batala
content: In Amritsar, Harjit Kaur, mother of gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria, and his aide Karanvir were fatally shot. Unidentified assailants on a motorcycle opened fire on their vehicle in Urban Estate. Karanvir died instantly, while Kaur succumbed to injuries in the hospital. Haryana gangsters Prabhu Dasuwal and Kaushal Chaudhary, linked to the Bambiha gang, claimed responsibility via social media.

title: 'Grave concerns': India slams Bangladesh over Durga temple demolition in Dhaka
content: India has strongly condemned the demolition of a Durga temple in Dhaka's Khilkhet, accusing the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government of siding with extremists. The ministry of external affairs expressed deep concern over the incident, stating the government failed to protect the temple and allowed its destruction despite potential alternatives.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 25,600; BSE Sensex opens over 100 points up
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday on the back of favourable global cues. While Nifty50 was near 25,600, BSE Sensex was up over 100 points.

title: 'Trying to do better' ‚Äì How a Spider-Man dialogue inspires India U-19 cricketer Harvansh Singh
content: India U-19 wicketkeeper-batter Harvansh Singh Pangalia shared how he was struggling at 13 off 23 balls before something clicked ‚Äî and went on to score a blistering 103 off 52 deliveries against England U-19 in a warm-up match. The 18-year-old is a Marvel fan, and his life motto revolves around a famous dialogue from Tobey Maguire's Spider-Man movie.

title: Himachal horror: Woman dies by suicide on Facebook live in Solan, blames self for lover‚Äôs death
content: A 20-year-old woman in Solan district allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself at her home in Olgi village, while live-streaming on Facebook. Police recovered a register where she explained her actions, citing her family's disapproval of her relationship and her belief that she was responsible for her partner's earlier suicide.

title: Telangana: How wife‚Äôs affair with boss led to husband‚Äôs murder
content: In Jogulamba Gadwal, police arrested eight individuals, including a newly-wed woman and her lover, for the murder of land surveyor Ganta Tejeshwar. V Tirumala Rao, the lover, and Aishwarya, the wife, orchestrated the crime, hiring contract killers with promises of cash. The gang murdered Tejeshwar on June 17, dumping his body in a canal after befriending him under false pretenses.

title: DRS disaster? Three shocking umpiring decisions in two days rock WI vs AUS Test- WATCH
content: The first Test between West Indies and Australia is marred by controversial third-umpire decisions. Several contentious calls by third umpire Adrian Holdstock have significantly impacted both teams, leading to widespread debate.

title: SCO Summit: India nixes Pakistan-China bid to push their line on terror
content: At the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation meet in Qingdao, India refused to endorse a joint statement on terrorism due to Pakistan's attempt, supported by China, to include unrelated issues and downplay cross-border terrorism. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh emphasized that there should be no double standards in addressing terrorism, stressing the need to hold perpetrators accountable.

title: Michelle on divorce rumors; explains why she's rarely seen with Barack Obama
content: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama has addressed rumors about her marriage with Barack Obama, attributing their infrequent public appearances to their age, stating they are "too old for Instagram". She explained her deliberate choice to skip high-profile events, prioritizing personal choices over public expectations. Obama also reflected on scaling back her ambitions as a working mother and first lady.

title: Stock recommendations for June 27 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a bullish outlook for the Indian stock market, highlighting Tata Steel and Lloyds Engineering Works as top picks. Nifty is expected to reach 25,700-25,900, while Bank Nifty aims for 58,500, driven by positive market breadth and technical breakouts.

title: Noida blaze: Fire engulfs Sector 2 commercial building; firefighters deployed
content: Early Friday morning, fires struck industrial areas in Noida and Delhi. A private firm in Noida's Sector 2 and a paint company in Bawana's Sector 2 were affected. While the cause of the Noida fire is unknown, 25 fire engines battled the Bawana blaze, with support from neighboring cities.

title: Who is Carter Hart? Canadian hockey star accused in the Hockey Canada sexual assault scandal
content: Carter Hart, once a celebrated NHL goaltender for the Philadelphia Flyers and a rising star in Canadian hockey, faces serious sexual assault charges related to the 2018 Hockey Canada scandal. These allegations have led to his indefinite leave from the Flyers, his status as an unrestricted free agent, and a significant downturn in his career.

title: US-China trade deal: Trump claims agreement signed'; says more deals coming
content: US President Donald Trump announced a signed trade agreement with China, hinting at a potentially significant deal with India soon. He suggested this India agreement would further open up trade opportunities. While expressing openness to deals, Trump indicated that not all nations would receive such offers, with some facing tariffs.

title: Fireball comet seen streaking across sky over Southeastern US, crashes into Georgia home
content: A bright fireball meteor streaked across the Southeast US, startling residents across four states with a sudden flash and loud boom. In Georgia, a home sustained damage from what is believed to be meteor debris crashing through the roof. While no injuries were reported, the event underscores the potential impact of space debris on Earth.

title: Harry Potter PJs spark Gaudreau memory: Meredith shares baby Carter‚Äôs photo
content: Meredith Gaudreau, wife of late NHL star Johnny Gaudreau, shared touching Instagram memories of their youngest son, Carter Michael. The photos highlighted Carter wearing outfits chosen by his father before his passing, including Harry Potter pajamas initially bought for their daughter, Noa.

title: Jaish terrorist being tracked for a year killed in J&K, 3 others trapped
content: Security forces neutralized a Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorist in a gunfight in the Basantgarh forests of Udhampur district, Jammu & Kashmir, while an operation continues to locate three other trapped militants. The group is believed to have been tracked by police in the Jammu region for almost a year.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô box office collection day 7: Aamir Khan starrer mints Rs 89 cr in India
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D‚ÄôSouza's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' has enjoyed a successful first week, nearing ‚Çπ90 crore at the Indian box office. The film, considered a spiritual sequel to 'Taare Zameen Par,' opened strong with ‚Çπ50 crore over the weekend. While weekday collections saw a dip, the movie maintained a steady pace. Directed by R.S. Prasanna, the film stars Khan as a basketball coach assigned to train athletes with intellectual disabilities.

title: College Football 26 gameplay deep dive details improvements
content: college football 26's wear and tear system allows players to swap athletes in and out without having to pause the game . users can tone down the damage of tackles or speed up recovery times . the system will not only have gameplay implications by lowering the performance .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Trade grades: Mammoth get an A+ for Peterka addition
content: the Utah Mammoth could add at least one top-six forward to their roster . if the Sabres would part ways with restricted free agent JJ Peterka, we'll look at how both front offices performed in this swap . in 2024-25, the Utah Hockey Club was a top-10 team in terms of shot share and shots per 60 minutes rate .

title: NBA trade tracker: Live updates during the 2025 draft
content: the 2025 offseason is here, and deals are getting done . on the last day of the season, the Phoenix Suns traded MVP Kevin Durant to the Houston Rockets for Jalen Green and Dillon Brooks . the grizzlies moved guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for a package of players and draft picks while the Eastern Conference champion Indiana Pacers reacquired their 2026 first-round pick .

title: Bradley's take: Will Paul's hook land better than Julio C√©sar Ch√°vez Jr.'s?
content: a 10-round cruiserweight bout against former middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. will be his 13th pro fight of 2025 . this will be Paul's first pro fight against a former boxing champ other than last November's fight against the then 58-year-old Mike Tyson . Chavez has fought only once since 2021 .

content: Cooper Flagg was drafted no. 1 by the Dallas Mavericks on friday night . he is considered among the best prospects of this millennium . we'll look at how he fits with the Mavs' roster as it is currently constructed .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Florida schools make big moves
content: two new teams within the top 10 . Texas A&M, Georgia, Texas, Miami and Florida State are all big movers . the noles have double-digit commitments including several ESPN 300 prospects . it's a major shift in the class rankings .

title: Axiom-4 mission: Shubhanshu Shukla and his fellow 'Earthlings' enter space station with Grace
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‚ÄòJewel Thieves‚Äô scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There‚Äôs always a story, one just has to find it. Read More

title: Is India plumbing the depths of groundwater?
content: Water-intensive agriculture and urban demand mean that India is using almost 60% of its groundwater every year. Governments have tried to increase supply, reduce demand and regulate consumption. But are these enough?

title: Lakhs of devotees arrive in Puri for Lord Jagannath's Rath Yatra
content: Elaborate arrangements are made as lakhs of devotees from across the country and abroad are expected to participate in the event, they said.

content: She was allegedly involved in extortion activities and had threatened officials and courier service operators in Imphal area

title: President Murmu extends greetings on Rath Yatra, prays for global peace
content: During the annual yatra, chariots of Lord Balabhadra, Devi Subhadra and Lord Jagannath are pulled from Shri Jagannath temple to Shree Gundicha temple in Puri. Similar yatras are also taken out in other parts of the country.

title: Elephant attack exposes perilous life of tribespeople in Malappuram
content: No help could reach the tribesman, Billy, for hours after he became the target of a wild elephant as there was no bridge to cross the river

title: First energy-efficient building of Andhra Pradesh to be inaugurated in Vizag today
content: Constructed on an energy-efficient model and equipped with energy-efficient appliances, the building will help save electricity bills, says APEPDCL CMD

title: A tightrope walk for Chittoor‚Äôs mango farmers
content: Mango farmers in Chittoor, which registered a bumper yield of over 10 lakh tonnes this season, are staring at massive losses as they are forced to sell their produce for a meagre ‚Çπ4 a kg, far from the government mandated ‚Çπ8, owing to delayed procurement by pulp-making units in the district. Poor MSP enforcement, alleged collusion among factories, and logistical bottlenecks arising out of global conflicts have exacerbated their plight, writes K Umashanker

title: Free seat hopes dashed as pvt. schools step back citing fee reimbursement dues in Andhra Pradesh
content: Poor students who were initially offered free admissions under the Right to Education (RTE) Act, have later been denied the same by some corporate schools citing lack of timely support from the government, parents in limbo as they have given up ‚ÄòThalli ki Vandanam‚Äô benefit also

title: Railings on footpaths push people on to the margins of roads
content: The YMCA intersection deals with a large volume of pedestrians, bus commuters and metro rail users, who primarily move towards the Jubilee Bus Station and getting quickly onto the footpath, especially after getting off buses is difficult

title: Telangana‚Äôs medical college expansion: Built to heal, left to rot
content: From shuttered duty rooms and unsafe hostels to sprawling, unopened hospitals, Telangana‚Äôs bold push to set up a government medical college in every district has resulted in an overstretched, understaffed system. Students are left to teach themselves, doctors go unpaid and faculty shortage cripple learning.¬†Siddharth Kumar Singh¬†exposes a public healthcare vision mired in delays, neglect and a widening gap between promise and practice

title: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla‚Äôs family meet U.P. CM Adityanath after his ISS entry

title: The big AI shake-up in Bengaluru
content: While Bengaluru is home to more than a lakh artificial intelligence professionals, AI has also brought with it fears of job loss. The launch of a survey recently by Karnataka‚Äôs Department of Information Technology and Biotechnology to assess the impact of AI on the workforce is an indication of the State getting set to face up to this multi-dimensional issue

title: Bombay HC orders preservation of dead man's semen on mother's plea
content:
Rosy Sequeira is special correspondent at The TImes of India, Mumbai
since July 2011. She has covered Bombay High Court for over nine years
which includes her earlier stints with other newspapers. Her forte is
on-the-spot accurate reporting. She tries to bring a human face to the otherwise largely
drab court proceedings and constantly looks out for judicial observations 
that strike a chord with the common man.
